messages.text: quick question: i tried to registrate my new package using Registrator.jl. I read somewhere I should have gotten an automatic robot-response but I didn't. Is that normal, can anyone help?

elements.text: quick question: i tried to registrate my new package using Registrator.jl. I read somewhere I should have gotten an automatic robot-response but I didn't. Is that normal, can anyone help?

messages.text: Yes, you should. The first checklist question is whether you have installed Registrator for your repository. It would also help with a pointer to your repository and the attempt to perform the registration.

elements.text: Yes, you should. The first checklist question is whether you have installed Registrator for your repository. It would also help with a pointer to your repository and the attempt to perform the registration.

messages.text:
Based the name off of `PkgTemplates.jl`, okay? Or want something like `PackageDeps.jl`?

- <https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/pull/32311>

elements.text: Based the name off of
PkgTemplates.jl
, okay? Or want something like
PackageDeps.jl
Repo URL does not end with /name.jl.git, where name is the package name
This can't always be met. For example this package
https://github.com/brainflow-dev/brainflow/tree/master/julia-package/brainflow
is in in a subdirectory of a repository with code in other languages as well. So we'll need to always manually merge pull requests for that package?

messages.text: Nah, AutoMerge will not run that check for subdirectory packages

elements.text: Nah, AutoMerge will not run that check for subdirectory packages

messages.text:
We are in the process of registering the package (<https://github.com/omlins/ParallelStencil.jl|ParallelStencil.jl>) and face a [compat] issue. ParallelStencil is not yet compatible with Julia 1.6. We thus specified this in the <https://github.com/omlins/ParallelStencil.jl/blob/61aaa7e0166672265388dbdedd13223c6ffd41f3/Project.toml#L7|Project.toml> as following
```julia = "1.0, 1.1, 1.2, 1.3, 1.4, 1.5"```
The auto-merge tests are successful and the <https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/pull/32779> PR should be merged in 24h. However, Julia compat seems to be ignored as I could install ParallelStencil.jl without complains on Julia 1.6 for test purpose using
```pkg> add <https://github.com/omlins/ParallelStencil.jl>```
How to proceed to set the compat for the package to be strictly `Julia 1.0 < ParallelStencil.jl < Julia 1.6` Do we miss something obvious or is the compat ignored adding the package over `https` ? Thanks

How to proceed to set the compat for the package to be strictly
Julia 1.0 < ParallelStencil.jl < Julia 1.6
Do we miss something obvious or is the compat ignored adding the package over
https
? Thanks
